variable.name: numResidues
variable.description: The number of residues to sample from.

variable.name: numResidues
variable.description: The number of residues to sample from.

variable.name: abscissa
variable.description: Abscissa where the integral is evaluated

variable.name: integral
variable.description: Values of the integral of the density probability function

variable.name: precision
variable.description: Precision of the abscissa. It is a ratio, e.g. 0.0001 means the abscissa are evaluated 10000 times in the total abscissa interval (which is fixed or not)

variable.name: excursion
variable.description: The abscissa interval, if not fixed, is evaluated at learning time. It is calculated to lie between mean - excursion * std and mean + excursion * std where mean and std are calculated on the dataset

variable.name: kernelWidth
variable.description: A double which is multiplied by the std of the dataset to determine, at learning time, the std of the gaussians used to approximate the density function

variable.name: learned
variable.description: Indicates if the sampler has already been learned

variable.name: fixedAbscissa
variable.description: Indicates if the abscissa must be evaluated dynamically or not.
